cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT. . . .The circulation of this paper has been strictly limited.It is issued for the personal use of...1^**.......most SECRET. Copy No......WjM, (44) 20TE CONCLUSIONS ." lilNUTE. confidential Annex(14th February, 1944 - 6.0 p*rn.)POLAND At the meeting of the War Cabinet on the7th February, the Prime Minister had reported the(Previous results of the discussions with Polish Ministers overReference: the previous weekend and said that he intended to.W.M.. (44) 16th report more fully to the Cabinet at a later date.Conclusions,Minute 3). THE PRIME MINISTER said that throughout thewhole week discussions had continued with the PolishMinisters. At the present time the Poles were making more difficulties about the Curzon Line -thanthey were about changes in the Polish Government.It seemed that they were hankering after a lineintermediate between the Curzon Lino and the RigaLine which thoro was no chance that Stalin would accept.THE FOREIGN SECRETARY said that he thoughtthat the Polish Ministers were afraid of takingresponsibility for a settlement on the lines proposed. It was of interest that they were losskeen, than might have been expected,to return toWarsaw as soon as it had been liberated-.The War Cabinet took note of this statement.Offices of the War Cabinet,S.W.1.
